title: Admissions & Human Anatomy
description: Foundations of patient intake and basic anatomical terminology.

items.prompt: Which body system is responsible for pumping blood throughout the body?
items.explanation: The circulatory system, powered by the heart, moves blood through the body.

items.prompt: During admission, what does 'Next of Kin' refer to?
items.explanation: 'Next of kin' is a person's closest living relative, who should be contacted in case of emergency.

items.prompt: Which organ is primarily used for breathing?
items.explanation: The lungs are the main organs of the respiratory system.

items.prompt: Choose the correct form: 'The doctor ___ (examine) patients every morning.'
items.explanation: We use the third-person singular 'examines' for a routine action in the Present Simple.

items.prompt: Choose the correct question: '___ the patient have any allergies?'
items.explanation: 'Does' is the correct auxiliary verb for the third-person singular (the patient) in Present Simple questions.

items.prompt:
Admission Note: 'Patient: Maria Garcia. Age: 45. Reason for admission: Severe abdominal pain. Allergies: Penicillin. Next of kin: Husband (Juan Garcia).' 

What medication should Maria NOT receive?
items.explanation: The note states Maria is allergic to Penicillin.
